Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'SqlCommand.SqlCommand(string, SqlConnection)' in 'AccessStaffRecord.AddStaff(string, string)' could contain the following variables 'username', 'password'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'SqlCommand.SqlCommand(string, SqlConnection)' in 'AccessStaffRecord.DeleteStaff(string)' could contain the following variables 'username'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.
Implement IDisposable on 'DAO' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'SqlConnection'.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: Review the query string passed to 'SqlCommand.SqlCommand(string, SqlConnection)' in 'ModifyStudentRecord.AddtoDB(string, string, string, string, string, string, string, string, string, string, int)' for possible SQL injection attacks. If the string is composed using any user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Rule.Name: Avoid uncalled private code
Rule.Description: There is uncalled code that is not externally visible and is not a known runtime entry point. If this violation fires in error, please send a problem report to the Visual Studio Code Analysis team.

Rule.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Name: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Description: A SQL command string built from user input is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. Microsoft SQL Server and other database servers support stored procedures and parameterized SQL queries, which reduce the risk of injection attacks.
Rule.Resolution: Review the query string passed to {0} in {1} for possible SQL injection attacks. If the string is composed using any user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

The query string passed to {0} in {1} could contain the following variables {2}. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}.
